result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin J. Brenneman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs and DNA surcharge within 60 days (7/28/14) or request a payment plan through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office within said time.

in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer consecutive with 90 days to be served immediately and 90 days are imposed and stayed for Defendant to obtain employment of at least 32 hours per week.  Review hearing set 10/14/14 at 8:15 a.m. in Br. 3 to determine whether the stayed 90 day jail sentence needs to be served.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed

12:55 Defendant Benjamin J. Brenneman in court, in custody with attorney Greg E Vollan (eligible).  Gilbert G Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within/waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets bond at $250 Cash bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Payment of warrant fees in the amount of $118.40 by next court date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 10:00 am.
